1.text: A wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish will pull down with her hands that also which is built.

2.text: He that walketh in the right way, and feareth God, is despised by him that goeth by an infamous way.

3.text: In the mouth of a fool is the rod of pride: but the lips of the wise preserve them.

4.text: Where there are no oxen, the crib is empty: but where there is much corn, there the strength of the ox is manifest.

5.text: A faithful witness will not lie: but a deceitful witness uttereth a lie.

6.text: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: the learning of the wise is easy.

7.text: Go against a foolish man, and he knoweth not the lips of prudence.

8.text: The wisdom of a. discreet man is to understand his way: and the imprudence of fools erreth.

9.text: A fool will laugh at sin, but among the just grace shall abide.

10.text: The heart that knoweth the bitterness of his own soul, in his joy the stranger shall not intermeddle.

11.text: The house of the wicked shall be destroyed: but the tabernacles of the just shall flourish.

12.text: There is a way which seemeth just to a man: but the ends thereof lead to death.

13.text: Laughter shall be mingled with sorrow, and mourning taketh hold of the end of joy.

14.text: A fool shall be filled with his own ways, and the good man shall be above him.

15.text: The innocent believeth every word: the discreet man considereth his steps. No good shall come to the deceitful son: but the wise servant shall prosper in his dealings, and his way shall be made straight.

16.text: A wise man feareth and declineth from evil: the fool leapeth over and is confident.

17.text: The impatient man shall work folly: and the crafty man is hateful.

18.text: The childish shall possess folly, and the prudent, shall look for knowledge.

19.text: The evil shall fall down before the good: and the wicked before the gates of the just.

20.text: The poor man shall be hateful even to his own neighbour: but the friends of the rich are many.

21.text: He that despiseth his neighbour, sinneth: but he that sheweth mercy to the poor, shall be blessed. He that believeth in the Lord, loveth mercy.

22.text: They err that work evil: but mercy and truth prepare good things.

23.text: In much work there shall be abundance: but where there are many words, there is oftentimes want.

24.text: The crown of the wise is their riches: the folly of fools, imprudence.

25.text: A faithful witness delivereth souls: and the double dealer uttereth lies.

26.text: In the fear of the Lord is confidence of strength, and there shall be hope for his children.

27.text: The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life, to decline from the ruin of death.

28.text: In the multitude of people is the dignity of the king: and in the small number of people the dishonour of the prince.

29.text: He that is patient, is governed with much wisdom: but he that is impatient, exalteth his folly.

30.text: Soundness of heart is the life of the flesh: but envy is the rottenness of the bones.

31.text: He that oppresseth the poor, upbraideth his Maker: but he that hath pity on the poor, honoureth him.

32.text: The wicked man shall be driven out in his wickedness: but the just hath hope in his death.

33.text: In the heart of the prudent resteth wisdom, and it shall instruct all the ignorant.

34.text: Justice exalteth a nation: but sin maketh nations miserable.

35.text: A wise servant is acceptable to the king: he that is good for nothing shall feel his anger.
